title: Hematoxylin & Eosin (H&E) Stain
description: A hematoxylin & eosin (H&E) stain was applied to this biopsy slide. The H&E stain is a good general stain for studying the overall structure of the kidney, especially cells from the renal tubule. It is typically the first stain a pathologist will review.

title: Periodic Acid-Schiff (PAS) Stain
description: A periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) stain was applied to this biopsy slide. In this stain certain areas of the kidney are stained purple, and the staining allows pathologists to get a good understanding of the amount and thickness of certain cells.

title: Silver Methenamine Stain
description: A silver methenamine stain, sometimes called a Jones' stain, was applied to this biopsy slide. This stain is commonly used in analyzing kidney diseases because it makes it easy to see an important part of the kidney called the glomerular basement membrane.

This stain is very helpful for detecting scarring (also called fibrosis), among other things. Scarring shows up as a blue color on the images.
